intro.heading: Professional Foundation Excavation and Backfilling
intro.content: Your foundation sets the stage for the entire structure. Our team provides accurate, safe, and efficient foundation excavation and backfilling for builders, contractors, and homeowners throughout Brant County and the surrounding area. We ensure the right depth, clean lines, proper soil handling, and reliable compaction—everything required for a strong, stable foundation.
keypoints: Full foundation digs for new builds and additions

includes.heading: Foundation Excavation Scope
includes.subheading: We handle every stage of the excavation, from layout to spoil removal to final grading, so your foundation is structurally ready and builder-approved.

items.title: Full Basement & Addition Excavation
items.description: We dig to engineered depth and specifications, ensuring accurate grades, clean edges, and safe soil management.

items.title: Over-Excavation & Soil Removal
items.description: When poor soil is discovered, we remove unsuitable material and haul it away with our triaxle fleet.

items.title: Professional Backfilling
items.description: We supply and place granular A or B material, ensuring proper lift thickness and long-term stability around the foundation.

items.title: Compaction for Structural Stability
items.description: Using a diesel plate tamper or roller, we compact the backfill to prevent future settling and drainage issues.

items.title: Rough Grading for Drainage
items.description: We shape the site around the home to direct water away from the structure and prepare the area for landscaping or construction.

items.title: Trucking & Spoil Removal
items.description: Our three triaxle dump trucks haul away all excess soil, keeping your site clean and ready for the next phase.

equipment.heading: Equipment Used for Foundation Excavation
equipment.subheading: Reliable equipment chosen for accuracy, efficiency, and safe excavation on every job site.

items.title: Mid-Size Excavator
items.description: Ideal for residential and commercial foundation digs, providing precise and efficient earthmoving.

items.title: Tri-Axle Dump Trucks
items.description: Used for spoil removal and material delivery, keeping your site clean and project on schedule.

items.title: Diesel Plate Tamper
items.description: Ensures proper compaction around the foundation for long-term stability.

items.title: Precision Layout Tools
items.description: We use a rotary laser level and GPS rover for accurate site layout, elevation checks, and cut/fill measurements, ensuring every excavation meets engineered specifications.

process.heading: How Our Excavation Process Works
process.subheading: A clear, predictable workflow that keeps your project on schedule from start to finish.

steps.title: Site Layout & Planning
steps.description: We review engineering drawings, confirm elevations, and establish accurate dig lines before any ground is broken.

steps.title: Excavation to Required Depth
steps.description: We excavate to engineered specifications, ensuring clean walls, correct depth, and proper soil management.

steps.title: Spoil Removal & Trucking
steps.description: Excess soil is hauled away using our dump trucks or supplemental rentals as needed.

steps.title: Fine Grading & Shaping
steps.description: We clean up the excavation, prepare the base, and ensure everything is ready for footings or foundation work.

steps.title: Backfilling After Foundation Work
steps.description: Once the foundation is complete, we place material in controlled lifts to protect walls and ensure long-term stability.

steps.title: Final Grading for Drainage
steps.description: We shape the surrounding area to promote proper drainage and prepare the site for its next phase.

serviceArea.heading: Service Area
serviceArea.content: We provide excavation, foundation digging, backfilling, and dump truck services throughout Brant County, Brantford, Hamilton, Cambridge, Kitchener–Waterloo, and surrounding Southern Ontario communities.

items.question: Do you remove all excess soil?
items.answer: Yes. Our triaxle fleet hauls away all spoil material as part of our excavation service.

items.question: Can you work in tight backyards?
items.answer: In most cases, yes. We assess access during the estimate and plan equipment size accordingly.

items.question: Do you handle compaction?
items.answer: Yes. We use plate tampers or rollers depending on the project requirements.

items.question: How far ahead should I book?
items.answer: Most projects book 1–3 weeks in advance, depending on the season.
